body: What principle in fluid mechanics states that an increase in the speed of a fluid corresponds to a decrease in its pressure?

A car that is initially moving at a speed of 20 meters per second uniformly accelerates to a speed of 30 meters per second over the course of 5 seconds. How far, in meters, does the car travel during this interval?
Which of the following terms describes two solutions that have the same solute concentration?
Plants stockpile excess glucose by synthesizing what polymer?
What is the name of the aura of plasma that surrounds the Sun and other stars?
Which of the following is the main factor that distinguishes a total solar eclipse from an annular solar eclipse?

choices.W: The distance between the moon and the Earth
choices.X: The position of the moon relative to the Earth
choices.Z: The position on Earth from which the eclipse is being viewed from

answer: W) THE DISTANCE BETWEEN THE MOON AND THE EARTH

body: What is the equation of the horizontal asymptote of the function $f$ of $x$ equals the fraction with numerator $4x$ cubed plus $6x$ squared minus 9 and denominator $x$ cubed plus $10x$ squared minus 5?
Find $f$ of $g$ of 4 if $f(x) = 3x - 2$ and $g(x) = x^2$.
What is the pH of a 0.01 molar sodium hydroxide solution?
How many moles of oxygen gas are required to completely combust 1 mole of propane?

Researchers at Ames National Lab are studying skyrmions, which are quasiparticles that could be used for efficient data storage. They discovered that skyrmions replicate similarly to what asexual cell division process that occurs in eukaryotes?

Researchers at Ames National Lab are studying skyrmion crystals. In order to determine the interior structure of small skyrmion crystals, the researchers used which of the following types of microscopes?
What is the power, in watts, dissipated by a 5-ohm resistor when 4 amps of current pass through it?
A 4-ohm, 6-ohm, and 12-ohm resistor are connected in parallel to a 12-volt battery. What is the equivalent resistance of the circuit?
What type of covalent bond is formed between two monosaccharides in a dehydration reaction?
Which of the following nucleotide bases is NOT a pyrimidine?
What is the name of the shadow zone that only allows observers to see a partial solar eclipse?
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of most minerals?
A drawer contains three blue socks, eight white socks, and two green socks. How many socks must be pulled out of the drawer, without replacement, to guarantee a pair of socks of the same color?
What are the roots of the polynomial $2x^{2} + 3x - 2$?
What is the oxidation number of phosphorus in $\athrm{P_4}$?
Which of the following gases has the slowest effusion rate?
Researchers at the National Energy Technology Laboratory are developing alternative energy sources by capturing what common greenhouse gas?

Researchers at the National Energy Technology Laboratory are using carbon dioxide to develop alternative energy sources in the STEP program. In this program, carbon dioxide is in what phase, where the distinction between liquid and gas disappears?
Which of the following quantities is a scalar?
The second harmonic of a note has a frequency of 220 hertz. In hertz, what is the frequency of the fifth harmonic of this note?
What is the term for when a pair of homologous chromosomes or sister chromatids fail to separate properly in meiosis?
Which of the following proteins assist in the proper folding of other proteins?
What was the first planet to be discovered using a telescope?
Which of the following best describes the distribution of water on Europa?

choices.X: Water vapor dominating most of the atmosphere
choices.Y: Liquid water underneath a layer of frozen ice

answer: Y) LIQUID WATER UNDERNEATH A LAYER OF FROZEN ICE

body: You roll four fair, standard six-sided dice. What is the most probable sum of the four numbers rolled?
A right triangle has a hypotenuse of length 25 and a side of length 24. What is the perimeter of the triangle?
What color does lithium emit in a flame test?
Rank the following three compounds in terms of increasing reactivity with water: 1) Lithium; 2) Sodium; 3) Potassium.

Researchers at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab are studying cuprates, which are high temperature superconductors. These materials exhibit what effect, which causes a superconductor to expel magnetic fields when it is cooled below its critical temperature?

Researchers at Lawrence Berkeley National Lab are studying the XPG protein, which binds to and reshapes damaged DNA. They also discovered that XPG has a role in what type of recombination, where nucleotide sequences are exchanged between two similar or identical molecules of DNA?
Which of the following equals the amount of work done on a planet as it makes one full orbit around the Sun?

choices.W: The total kinetic energy of the planet
choices.X: The total potential energy of the planet
choices.Y: The total mechanical energy of the planet
choices.Z: No work is done on the planet

answer: Z) NO WORK IS DONE ON THE PLANET

body: Object A is moving towards Object B at 0.6 times the speed of light. Object A emits a beam of light directly towards B. In terms of the speed of light, c, what is the speed of the emitted photons in Bâ€™s reference frame?
Which of the following is an example of temporal reproductive isolation?

choices.W: Two species have different courtship rituals
choices.X: Two species live in different habitats
choices.Y: Two species only come in contact with each other during the summer
choices.Z: Two species breed during different seasons

answer: Z) TWO SPECIES BREED DURING DIFFERENT SEASONS

body: A lichen is a symbiotic relationship between what two types of organisms?
Which of the following is an accurate description of Kepler's second law?

choices.W: A line connecting the Sun to any planet sweeps out equal areas in equal intervals of time
choices.X: The square of a planet's orbital period is proportional to the cube of its semimajor axis
choices.Y: The orbital paths of planets are elliptical, with the Sun at one focus
choices.Z: The total kinetic energy of a planet is equal to negative one-half times the total potential energy of the planet

answer: W) A LINE CONNECTING THE SUN TO ANY PLANET SWEEPS OUT EQUAL AREAS IN EQUAL INTERVALS OF TIME

body: What process is characterized by the accumulation of small particles into more massive objects through gravitational attraction?
Which of the following numbers is divisible by both 3 and 5?
How many positive integer factors does the number 110 have?
Which of the following is the IUPAC systematic name of the compound $\athrm{FeCr_2O_7}$?
To the nearest degree, what is the bond angle in sulfur trioxide?
